availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Millender E. Ingram (Pulaski County, Kentucky, hotel proprietor. )

body.p: Pulaski County, Kentucky, hotel proprietor. Arkansas, native. Married to Adaliza Zachary Ingram in Pulaski County, Kentucky, on November 14, 1854. Father of William Ingram, Benjamin Ingram, Frank Ingram, and Louisa Ingram. Farmer in Pulaski County in 1850. Household owned four enslaved persons in Pulaski County in 1850. Hotel proprietor in Pulaski County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Pulaski County in 1860. Hotel keeper in Pulaski County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Division 1, p. 73B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Division 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Somerset, p. 156.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski, Somerset, p. 195A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Somerset, p. 378B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Pulaski County, KY, July 1863, p. 187.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pulaski County Marriages, Film 000804052.
"Millender E. Ingram (1833-1872)," Find A Grave, Memorial 12410850, accessed June 2, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/12410850.
